Name: Amman
Description: The capital and largest city of Jordan, known for its historical sites, modern infrastructure, and cultural significance.

Name: Zarqa
Description: A city located northeast of Amman, known as an industrial hub with a large population.

Name: Irbid
Description: Located in the northern part of Jordan, Irbid is an important cultural and educational center.

Name: Aqaba
Description: Jordan s only coastal city, located on the Red Sea, known for its tourism, beaches, and port.

Name: Mafraq
Description: A city in the northern region of Jordan, near the Syrian border, known for its agricultural and strategic importance.

Name: Maan
Description: A city in southern Jordan, known for its mining and agricultural industries, as well as its proximity to the desert.

Name: Karak
Description: A historical city known for the Karak Castle and its ancient ruins, located in central Jordan.

Name: Ajloun
Description: A city in the north-western part of Jordan, known for its green hills, forests, and historical sites.

Name: Tafilah
Description: A city in southern Jordan, located in the mountainous region, known for its agricultural significance and proximity to the Jordan Rift Valley.

Name: Balqa
Description: A governorate located in central Jordan, known for its agricultural land, as well as the popular Dead Sea area.
